hotciv.framework

Interface Tile

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TileImpl

    public interface Tile
    Tile represents a single territory tile of a given type. Responsibilities: 1) Know its type and position on the board. This source code is from the book "Flexible, Reliable Software: Using Patterns and Agile Development" published 2010 by CRC Press. Author: Henrik B Christensen Computer Science Department Aarhus University This source code is provided WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY either expressed or implied. You may study, use, modify, and distribute it for non-commercial purposes. For any commercial use, see http://www.baerbak.com/

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearUnit()
      Remove the current unit from the calling tile
      City getCity()
      A getter for retrieving the current city on the calling tile
      Position getPosition()
      return position of this tile on the board.
      java.lang.String getTypeString()
      return the tile type as a string.
      Unit getUnit()
      A getter for retrieving the current unit on the calling tile

      Set the city on the calling tile

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        Position getPosition()
        return position of this tile on the board.
        Returns:
        position of tile.

      • getTypeString

        java.lang.String getTypeString()
        return the tile type as a string. The set of valid strings are defined by the graphics engine, as they correspond to named image files.
        Returns:
        the type type as string

      • setCity

        boolean setCity(City newCity)
        Set the city on the calling tile
        Parameters:
        newCity - the new city to place on the tile
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • getCity

        City getCity()
        A getter for retrieving the current city on the calling tile
        Returns:
        the current city on the tile

      • getUnit

        Unit getUnit()
        A getter for retrieving the current unit on the calling tile
        Returns:
        the current unit on the tile

      • setUnit

        void setUnit(Unit newUnit)
        Setter to change the current unit on the calling tile
        Parameters:
        newUnit - the new unit to place on the tile

      • clearUnit

        void clearUnit()
        Remove the current unit from the calling tile
